data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions say 4 steps and turning around. The direction of the turn is around. Turning right would be the second turn after taking 4 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take the amount of time you took taking 4 steps. Then take 6 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you took a single step after you took 5 steps, the original number of steps is 7 - 5. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot take 10 steps and take 9 steps at the same time. We can say the same thing for taking 3 steps, which would be 5. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around if you return to your starting point. To return back to where you started from, you proceed as you started. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Turn left. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn round you start a new direction. Take 8 steps, turn around, take 2 steps. Turn around you turn around, take 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Before the 5th step, you should face forward. When you are taking 4 steps forward, if you are facing 1 step left, you will take 4 steps forward. When you are taking 6 steps forward, if you are facing 6 steps forward, you will take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 9 steps and turn around, you take 7 steps. It is only possible to return to the starting point by taking 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If one always faces forward there is no need for one to take a step backward. One needs to take one step forward and one step backward in order to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If we always face forward, we are always facing forward in the directions. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is always forward to always face forward. Takes 10 steps left is 10 steps backward in one sequence. If you follow this sequence you can always return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you will always be facing straight in the direction you want to go. If you take 4 steps left, you are facing straight up. If you take 3 steps forward, you are facing straight down. If you take 1 step right, you are facing right. So, the answer is Yes.

Your starting point is facing forward. Any time you move your focus, it moves towards you. The starting point is facing forward. Remember to always face ahead when you are facing forward. So, the answer is yes.

You don’ t return to the starting point by taking 10 steps. You return to the starting point by making several turns. So, the answer is No.

In the second sequence, you take a step first, then take 1 step and 1 step then take 3 steps to return to the starting point. The first sequence takes you back to the 1st step, then the 2nd, then the 3rd and last one is the return to the starting point sequence. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 5 steps, you would start from an upward location like the starting point. You would take 3 steps, you would start from an downward location like the starting point. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. The first set of instructions require you to always face forward, and the second set is for you to take steps backward. So, the answer is No.
